rows.text: Used as an Independent station from 1974 to 1984; station currently brands its newscast as "PIX 11 News"
Used from 1989–1997, has identified as "CBS 2 News" from 1997–present, and "CBS 2 NewsCentral" from September–January 2010
Used briefly in the early 1970s, newscasts are now branded as "CBS 2 News"
Originator of the "Action News" format on April 6, 1970
WPVI-produced broadcasts on WPHL are branded as "Action News @10 on PHL17"
Newscast defunct, station formerly referred to itself as "Action 36". Currently broadcasts newscast from sister station, KTVU.
Used from 1971 to the early 1980s. Newscasts are now branded as "KTVU Fox 2 News".
Used from 1979–1984, its years of using Move Closer to Your World; has identified as "NBC 5 News" since 1999

Identified as Action News from 1972–1988, has identified as "Channel 2 Action News" since 1988. The station's newscasts still remain very fast-paced, keeping some aspects of the Action News format today.
Used since 1972; currently identifies as "Channel 7 Action News"
Has identified as "ABC Action News" since 2002
Identified as "Action NewsCenter" in 1977, then as "Action 10 News" from 1978 to 1979, and finally as "Action News" from 1979 to 1989. Currently identifies as "10 News"
Used during the 1980s; has identified as "12 News" since 1992, and "12 News in HD" since November 2006.
Used during the early 1970s; now identifies as "WCCO 4 News"
Used from 1989–1995; has identified as "South Florida's CBS 4 News" since 1999
Has identified as "19 Action News" from 2002-2015. Now identifies as "Cleveland 19 News" since September 2015, produces "Cleveland 19 News at 10 on CLE 43" for WUAB
Identified as "Action 3 News" from 1974–1984; has identified as "Channel 3 News" since 1984; unrelated to WOIO
Used from 1977–1983; has identified as "Channel 2 News" since June 2010
Newscast produced by WFTV was rebranded to Eyewitness News.
Used as an ABC affiliate in the 1970s; has identified as "CBS 13 News" since 2005
The CW (formerly UPN, WB and independent)
Used in the 1990s; formerly unrelated to KOVR
Used during the early and mid-1970s; has identified as "Fox 2 News" since 1995

Used in 1970s–1989; Brought back again in 1995 as "Channel 4 Action News". Currently branded as "Action News 4." One of the few that used the name to put emphasis on investigative reporting, with the slogan being "Taking Action For You."
Identified as "Action News" from 1973–1985, has identified as "11 News" since 1995 and also identified as "WBAL-TV 11 News".
Produced by WSOC-TV; newscasts are now branded as "Eyewitness News"
Identified as "Carolina's NewsChannel 36" from 2008-2012, has identified as "NBC Charlotte News" since 2012; unrelated to WAXN/WSOC
Used briefly in the 1970s; title was followed by the current year à la Match Game (i.e., "Action News '75"); has identified as News 8 since 1996
Used from 1971–1996; has identified as "News 8" since 2010; former sister station of WPVI
Used during the 1970s and 1980s; Sister station of Fox affiliate WRAZ. Has identified as "WRAL News" since 2003.
Identified as "NBC Action News" from 2003-2012; has identified as "41 Action News" since early 2012, after the station rebranded.
Used from 1974–1990; has identified as "Fox 4 News" since 1997; unrelated to KSHB
Identified as "Action News 4" from 1975-1979; has identified as "ABC 4 Utah" since 2013
Used as WTVN; has identified as "ABC 6 News" since 2006
Used from the mid-1970s to the mid-1980s; has identified as "News 5" since 2004
Used from 1976 (when it was still a CBS affiliate) to 1985; has identified as "12 News" since 2003, though the station's consumer news/investigation segments continue to be called "Action 12".
Used from 1975–1981; has identified as "WYFF News 4" since 1996
Used in the 1980s and early 1990s; has identified as "NewsChannel 5" since 1993
Used in the 1970s; identified as "NBC 13 News" until 2010; currently identified as "WVTM 13 News"
Used in the 1980s and 1990s; currently identifies as WIAT News 42, unrelated to WVTM
Used as a CBS affiliate; currently identifies as "CBS 21 News at Ten on The CW 15"

Used since 2000, WestNet Wireless launched the first Action News brand online with its web-broadcast style format for the markets of Calgary, Alberta and Santa Barbara, California WestNet also owns the trademark for Action News in Canada and even owns the domain http://action.news
Has identified as "Channel 13 Action News" since 2003
Has identified itself as "Action 7 News" since 1978
Used from the mid-1970s to when it switched from CBS to ABC; has identified as "WHAS 11 News" since 1991
Used during the mid- and late 1970s; currently identifies as "First Coast News", unrelated to WTEV and WAWS
Rebranded to title in April 2009, with sister station WAWS.
Rebranded to title in April 2009, with sister station WTEV.
Used during its CBS days; has identified as "ABC 6 News" since 1995
Used from 1978–1997; has identified as "KVUE News" since 2001
Used circa 1999-2001; station ended its newscasts on April 3, 2009; newscasts have been branded as "Eyewitness News" after sister station WBRE began producing its newscasts in 2012
Has never been known as "Action News," but has used "Move Closer to Your World" theme for several years
Has identified as "ABC 30 Action News" since 1994, but uses the "Eyewitness News" format of KABC and KGO; title began on September 14, 1970
Used during its first few years as an ABC affiliate; has identified as "News 10" since 1995
Newscast name used before its purchase by Gannett; Currently identifies as "Today's THV"
Used from 1990 to 1997; currently identifies as "Fox 10 News"
Used "Action 10 News" from 1970–1974 and 1978–April 2004; has identified as "10 News" since April 2004
Used in the 1970s, 1980s, and the mid-late 1990s; has identified as "LEX 18 News" since 2000
Identified as "Action News 36" from 2004–2009, identified as "ABC 36 News" since 2009.
Used from its ABC days and with CBS up to 1993; currently identifies as "13 News"
Used during the 1980s. Has identified as "WSLS 10 On Your Side" since 2006
Used "Action 2 News" from 1979 to 1982; has identified as "KHON2 News" since 2003
Identified as "13 Action News" until 2006, identified as "13 ABC Action News" since 2006; former sister station of WPVI; also known to use the "Eyewitness News" format
Newscasts were branded as "Action 3 News" from 2006-2017 when it was rebranded '3 News Now'.
Known as "Channel 6 Action News" from the mid 70's to 1991, then changed to "Channel 6 News". Known as "WOWT 6 News" since 2012.
Used from 1974 to 1993, as "KY3 Action News"; has identified as "KY3 News" since 1997
Has identified as KLEW Action News since 2008. The station is part of the Spokane, Washington market, but does not serve as the Spokane metro area's CBS affiliate; it is served by KREM-TV.
Used during the 1980s; Currently identifies as "KTBS 3 News"
Used from 1975 to 1985, currently identifies as "WHNT News 19"
Used in the 1970s; has identified as "News 3" since 2001
Used throughout the 1970s 1980s and early 1990s; has identified as "NewsChannel 9" since 1995
Used during the 1970s; has identified as "16 WAPT News" since 1999
Used as WMT-TV; has identified as "CBS 2 News" since 2004
Used during the 1980s; currently identifies as "Local 4 News"
Used from 1990s–1997; currently identifies as "WJCL News"
Used during the 1980s; currently identifies as "WTAJ News"
Used in the 1990s; has identified as "KDBC 4 News" since 2004
Used as an ABC affiliate; has identified as "News 2" since 1997
Used from 1970s-2001; has identified as "21 News" since 2001
Used from 1986–1993; was identified as "WPDE NewsChannel 15" from 1993 until the station's re-branding on April 22, 2015; has identified as "ABC 15 News" since then
Used in the 1990s; has identified as "ABC 27 News" since 2006
Used during the 1970s and 1980s. Currently identifies as "News 10"
Used from the late 1960s to the late 1970s; has identified as "News 12" since 1998
Used from the 1990s-2003; currently identifies as "NBC Augusta"
Identified as "KSFY Action News" from September 2008 to 2011; currently identifies as "KSFY News"
Used from the early to late 1970s; has identified as "WMBD 31 News" since 2007
Used in the 1980s, currently identifies as "CBS 8 News"
Identified as "Action News" from 1977-1984; has identified as "NewsChannel 3" since 2013

Originally Identified itself as "Action 6 News" (1970s-early 1980s), "6 Action News" (late 1980s-2007) and "KSBY 6 Action News" (2007–2010) and was a sister station of KSBW, which also uses the "Action News" format. Currently identifies as "KSBY 6 News" as of 2010.
Used in the 1980s and 1990s; currently identifies as "TV-3 News"
Formerly NewsWatch. Has identified as Action News since 2007.
Identified as "Action 8 News" from 1976 to 1987; currently identifies as "News 8"
Identified as Action 9 News from the late 1960s to 1992; then identified as THE News Leader; has identified as "WTVM News Leader 9" since 1996
Merged with KNVN to form NCN in 2001 to be later renamed as "Action News"; has identified as "Action News Now" since 2013
Merged with KHSL after having lowest ratings out of all three of the area's news stations and to not waste money on a failing station; has identified as "Action News Now" since 2013
Used in the 1980s; has identified as "NBC 4 News" since 2002
Used from the 1980s. Has identified as "23 News" since 2003
Used in the 1980s; has identified as "Eyewitness News" since 1988
Identified as "Action 7 News" 1979-1996, has identified as "7 News" since 1998
Started as "Action 10 News" in 1985 and later became "Action 10 News WTHI." Became "News 10" in 2006.
The newscast has been called "Action News" since the station's inception in the 1950s.
Used during the early 1980s; currently identifies as "KTXS News 12"
Used in the early 1970s as "Action News Central"
Used from 1976 to 1995; currently identifies as "Black Hills Fox News"
Used until its news department were shut down; newscast now produced by Independent News Network
Used from 1977–1984; currently identifies as "WHSV News 3"
Used from 1980-2004: currently identifies as "Channel 11 News"
Never used the "Action News" title but used its news format, station calls itself "Channel 7 Eyewitness News"
